author: mininny
content: Thank you! Yep, I'll use spamoor to send blob txs. Is there a specific spamoor scenario that you'd like to see the test with?

author: mininny
content:
Hi team, I'm also working on running a peerdas devnet and loading the network with high blob throughput. 
However, even after setting target/max blob count to 48/72, the network only seems to include 6 blobs per block. here's the [genesis.json](https://github.com/testinprod-io/ethereum-devnets/blob/main/network-configs/peerdas-devnet-ssl-1/metadata/genesis.json) used to create the network. 
Is there any specific configuration related to peerdas that's required to adjust the blob counts that I should look at?

author: jimmygchen
content: have you also set `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK_FULU` on the CL side?

author: jimmygchen
content: btw we haven't implement this config value in Lighthouse, might have to set the blob count in Electra with `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK_ELECTRA` if you're running Lighthouse

author: mininny
content: We set `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK_FULU` and `MAX_BLOBS_PER_BLOCK_ELECTRA` when generating the genesis; You mean that we should set it as environment variables when running the CL?

author: samcm
content:
> do you think they can repurpose your blob analysis playbooks on the xatu data they're collecting? s

Yup should be able to! <@288990561279541248> could you PM me some creds for the clickhouse running within `xatu-stack`?  Should exist here: https://github.com/testinprod-io/ethereum-devnets/blob/main/ansible/inventories/peerdas-devnet-ssl-1/group_vars/all/all.sops.yaml#L29-L34

author: mininny
content: Sent! üôè

author: jimmygchen
content: When you generate genesis, you also had the CL config generated right? (`config.yaml`) - this needs to be specified when running a CL. With lighthouse you provide the custom network directory containing this file via the `--testnet-dir` flag, and the CL will read the config from this file.

author: mininny
content: target/max blob setting in peerdas

author: jtraglia
content: Just sharing because I think it's neat. The new M4 macs compute cells & proofs in 105ms with the recommended `precompute=8` setting. And 80ms with the max-perf `precompute=15` setting. [Benchmarks](https://gist.github.com/jtraglia/698a4f7bd43764db19753f9fa046998e). This is quite a big jump in performance.

we have an image for EL cell proof computation interop: `ethpandaops/lighthouse:peerdas-devnet-6-898e3fa`
it's not fully complete (missing checkpoint sync, blob sidecar endpoint etc) but the features needed for interop is there.
I haven't been managed to produce the first block with geth yet though. If any EL has a branch ready let me know!
